body:
> > > Thanks for the contribution @conker84 , I am curious to know what will happen when the ksql return infinite data, will it cause frontend crash ?
> > 
> > 
> > great question @zjffdu , the output gets truncated when the `ZEPPELIN_INTERPRETER_OUTPUT_LIMIT` is reached.
> 
> Do you have any idea to improve it ? It is not a specific problem for ksql, but a general issue for all streaming job.

Do you mean for the back-end?
I should take a deep look into the Interpreter lifecycle management, but if we want to do it with the KISS principle maybe by simply adding a boolean property like `ZEPPELIN_INTERPRETER_STOP_ON_OUTPUT_LIMIT_REACHED`, that automatically stops the paragraph when the limit is reached, could be a flexible and "simple" solution.
@hsuanxyz Could you add apache license header ?

@zjffdu ~Ok, I will add a tslint rule that will automatically be added the license header when each time commit.~

Finally used IDE to add the license header, because the tslint is only works for `*.ts` files.

@zjffdu - re-running fixed some of the tests but for the 0.8 branch it fails with

`Failed tests: 
  PersonalizeActionsIT.testGraphAction:251 The output of graph mode is not changed
Expected: "fa fa-bar-chart"
but: was "fa fa-table"`

is this a bad selenium test or a real failure?   same check fails on master.

Thanks @hsuanxyz . Here's my comments:
1. In the PR description, the `Note` column in table should be renamed to `Description`
2. Does `package-lock.json` need to be committed ? https://stackoverflow.com/questions/44206782/do-i-commit-the-package-lock-json-file-created-by-npm-5

Besides that, could you list your plan after this PR ? One important task is adding this into travis build so and add integration test ? The examples you listed in PR description is pretty helpful, especially when we could add them into integration instead of manually tested them each time.
@prabhjyotsingh Could you help review this ?
No, I mean the frontend. Ideally backup should always send streaming data to frontend, but frontend should do the truncation. e.g. frontend would always keep the latest 1000 records.
hmm, that is flaky test. I will merge the PR soon
@alexott I have merged this PR, could you close it ?
Thanks for the contribution @hsteinmueller , this PR LGTM, could you paste the travis build link ?
@hsuanxyz why is the network visualization not implemented?

Just a general question - maybe instead of `sparql` name for interpreter, use something like, `sparql.jena`, so it's possible in the future to use different implementations? Or extend implementation to have different backends selected via configuration?

P.S. I'm really to keen to try this implementation...

IIUC, `jena` is one implementation of `sparql`. Since interpreter text `%sparql` is user facing, I would prefer to configure the implementation of `sparql` in interpreter setting instead of via interpreter text.
@conker84 We plan to continue development after this PR review is done. All tasks in the list will be completed.

@zjffdu 

> 1. In the PR description, the Note column in table should be renamed to Description

- Done

> 2. Does package-lock.json need to be committed ?

- Added

I have added the `pom.xml` configuration file, now `build` and `test` will run in CI. We will add more tests after the project is relatively stable.

**Question:**
Does it also work the other way round?
Meaning I would like to put a variable in Python and get it in Angular.

> **Question:**
> Does it also work the other way round?
> Meaning I would like to put a variable in Python and get it in Angular.

Good point, It also works the other way round. I have updated the screenshot in the PR description.

Thanks for the contribution @gkomlossi. This PR LGTM, just 2 minor comments:
1. Could you correct the PR title ?
2. Please paste the travis build link to make sure the CI pass

Thanks for checking, @zjffdu. Here is the travis link: https://travis-ci.org/gkomlossi/zeppelin/builds/602501345 , I also have it hidden it in the PR summary under "CI link". 
I'm sorry, I'm not sure what the title should be. Could you please give a hint?
Awesome, can't wait for that!!!
Thanks @alexott  LGTM
Oh I see. Well I agree with you about showing the latest 1k (configurable?!) records
I can open an issue about that
apache/zeppelin:0.8.2 from docker hub still failing
@resdevd What do you mean failing ? I see the docker image is built successfully on docker hub. Do you mean you fail to start zeppelin ?

> Thanks for the contribution @hsteinmueller , this PR LGTM, could you paste the travis build link ?

https://travis-ci.org/hsteinmueller/zeppelin

> IIUC, `jena` is one implementation of `sparql`. Since interpreter text `%sparql` is user facing, I would prefer to configure the implementation of `sparql` in interpreter setting instead of via interpreter text.

Do you want me to update the interpreter settings with this functionality or will this be changed once another implementation gets added?
Is there anything else that I can do for this PR?

@zjffdu Added your fix for the test interactions and reran the CI: https://travis-ci.org/jpmcmu/zeppelin/builds/604480943. Two failures but they don't look like they are related to these changes to me
LGTM :)

@zjffdu  let me know if you need anything else to merge this pull request.  As noted above.  the only failing test is also failing on the 0.8 branch.  https://travis-ci.org/apache/zeppelin/jobs/602814625  

I would love to get this into the 0.8.3 release.

Thanks!
Tony
Thanks @conker84 @Tagar will merge this PR if no more comment
@gkomlossi Sorry, I didn't make it clear, your PR title is truncated. It should be "Resource.invokeMethod() doesn't find the right method to call"
Thanks @jpmcmu will merge it soon
@jpmcmu I have merged this PR, what is your apache account ? I will assign the ticket to you.
Thanks @primerano LGTM will merge if no more comments

@jpmcmu Test is failed on master, could you help check it ?

https://travis-ci.org/apache/zeppelin/jobs/604759403
```
Failed tests: 
  ParagraphTest.credentialReplacement:393 
Wanted but not invoked:
interpreter.interpret(
    "val x = "usr={user.ent}&pass={password.ent}"",
    <any>
);
-> at org.apache.zeppelin.notebook.ParagraphTest.credentialReplacement(ParagraphTest.java:393)
 
However, there were other interactions with this mock:
interpreter.getClassName();
-> at org.apache.zeppelin.notebook.ParagraphTest.credentialReplacement(ParagraphTest.java:392)
 
interpreter.getInterpreterGroup();
-> at org.apache.zeppelin.notebook.ParagraphTest.credentialReplacement(ParagraphTest.java:392)
```

I am trying to upgrade Zeppelin to 0.8.2 and having problems with depInterpreter. I am loading jars with depInterpreter and using them as dependencies in a spark paragraph. The paragraph fails beacause it does not have the jars in its classpath. By setting the "zeppelin.spark.useNew" property to false the spark paragraph succeeds. Could this be related also to [this](https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/pull/3353) change in 0.8.2?

I am trying to upgrade Zeppelin to 0.8.2 and having problems with depInterpreter. I am loading jars with depInterpreter and using them as dependencies in a spark paragraph. The paragraph fails beacause it does not have the jars in its classpath. By setting the "zeppelin.spark.useNew" property to false the spark paragraph succeeds. Could this be related also to this issue resolved in 0.8.2?
@alonshoham new SparkInterpreter doesn't support dep interpreter. If you want to add thrid party libraries, you need to set spark property  `spark.jars` or `spark.jars.packages`
@zjffdu , oh thanks. I fixed it.
Thanks @gkomlossi Please paste the travis CI link when it is finished

Thanks @zjffdu 
Will the new spark interpreter support depInterprter in the future? I saw that there is an [ignored test](https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/blob/da73634354afcfae7650c88baa7e6c2eae4669c5/spark/interpreter/src/test/java/org/apache/zeppelin/spark/NewSparkInterpreterTest.java#L368) with a comment by you about this behavior. My application relies on the functionality of depInterprter, I create notebooks with code that I compile and load with the depInterpreter. What do you suggest that I do?

@alonshoham You can use generic configuration instead. 

http://zeppelin.apache.org/docs/0.8.2/usage/interpreter/overview.html#generic-confinterpreter
e.g.
```
%spark.conf

spark.jars           your_local_jar
spark.jars.packages      your_needed_packages
```

Thanks. Now, you can validate `shiro.ini` before injecting it into Jetty. I think we could add your logic inside `public static void main` directly. But you might consider the case that `shiro.ini` doesn't exist and isn't needed. And could you please add test cases?

> Thanks. Now, you can validate `shiro.ini` before injecting it into Jetty. I think we could add your logic in side `public static void main` directly. But you might consider the case that `shiro.ini` doesn't exist and isn't needed. And could you please add tests cases?

Yes, we can directly add logic in `public static void main` but I have used injection to avoid updating existing test-cases and I have to write new test class under `configuration` dir, right as it is configuration related validation.

Based on the `shiro.ini` file we are checking the triggering the Authentication Service, so if shiro path exists then only we are validating it.
@zjffdu , here is the link: https://travis-ci.org/gkomlossi/zeppelin/builds/602501345
Thanks @gkomlossi , I will merge it soon
@zjffdu Sure, I will take a look at the test failure. My apache account user: jpmcmu

Thanks for the contribution @amakaur 
It makes sense to include user name and note id in the spark app name. But one easier approach is to set `spark.app.name` in `SparkInterpreterLauncher`, you can set `spark.app.name` to be `interpreterGroupId` which is consisted of note id and user name. Here's the logic how `interpreterGroupId` is generated.  https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/blob/master/zeppelin-zengine/src/main/java/org/apache/zeppelin/interpreter/InterpreterSetting.java#L406
Thanks for the contribution, @amakaur  Could you add unit test  ?
Thanks @amakaur for the contribution, is it possible to add unit test for this ?

Thanks. I missed it. Then we could check if some objects are inherited from
`AuthorizingRealm` or not, correct?

@Leemoonsoo I can see github action on pull request for my repo, but unable to trigger github action for apache repo. I think github action is enabled for apache project, so I suspect maybe it is due to zeppelin itself. Do you know how the jenkins job is triggered before ? Maybe it causes the github action untouched.

many ways including reflection.

We will not get a list of realms classes directly(by reading .ini file); also I have checked [getRealmsList()](https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/blob/master/zeppelin-server/src/main/java/org/apache/zeppelin/service/ShiroAuthenticationService.java#L133) here also we are getting loading the `SecurityManager` class to get realms list.

I think we have to follow the earlier implementation approach.
@hsteinmueller Could you update the pom.xml to resolve the conflict ?

> > Thanks for the contribution @hsteinmueller , this PR LGTM, could you paste the travis build link ?
> 
> https://travis-ci.org/hsteinmueller/zeppelin
> 
> > IIUC, `jena` is one implementation of `sparql`. Since interpreter text `%sparql` is user facing, I would prefer to configure the implementation of `sparql` in interpreter setting instead of via interpreter text.
> 
> Do you want me to update the interpreter settings with this functionality or will this be changed once another implementation gets added?

I mean to use interpreter setting to choose which implementation.  e.g. Add interpreter setting `sparql.type`.  IIUC, user don't care about the implementation of sparql ( I may be wrong ), only administrator care about that, so we should put ti in interpreter setting which is often maintained by administrator.
It is merged, could you close this PR ? @primerano
I have merged it, could you close this PR ? @hsuanxyz

> I have merged it, could you close this PR ?

@zjffdu Thank your.
Will that still be merged to master?

Thanks for the suggestion @zjffdu , i tried setting spark.app.name in SparkInterpreterLauncher#buildEnvFromProperties through env variable "SPARK_APP_NAME" and via spark property "spark.app.name", but didn't seem to work. It sets spark.app.name to default value "Zeppelin".
@amakaur How do you set that ? Can you show me the code ?
@jolo-dev  It is merged into master

@zjffdu Yes, I can launch the container with command:-
docker run -p 8080:8080 --rm --name zeppelin apache/zeppelin:0.8.2

However web server would never start at localhost:8080. Tried every possible thing including clearing cache, trying in different browsers/different servers (linux and mac). Interestingly 0.8.1 docker image works fine without any issues. 

Below are logs from the 0.8.2 docker container (container doesn't fail, just webserver would not show up in localhost:8080)


Nov 03, 2019 6:20:30 PM org.glassfish.jersey.internal.Errors logErrors
WARNING: The following warnings have been detected: WARNING: A HTTP GET method, public javax.ws.rs.core.Response org.apache.zeppelin.rest.CredentialRestApi.getCredentials(java.lang.String) throws java.io.IOException,java.lang.IllegalArgumentException, should not consume any entity.

@resdevd You need to pass env ZEPPELIN_ADDR='0.0.0.0', otherwise it would listen on 127.0.0.1. Will update the document

Try this branch which works for me.
https://github.com/zjffdu/zeppelin/commit/47a50c0ae73c9fc8c5441572cee0d9164106a60f

And set spark.app.name to be empty in interpreter setting page first.
Sure, let me try.

After debugging i realized that the reason my changes weren't working was because spark.app.name was getting overridden by the default value set in interpreter-setting. 

i did checkout your branch and got the following result.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/51380329/68102303-eaceb980-fe86-11e9-85fa-b42c72ff30cd.png)
Awesome, would you update this PR and add unit test ?
BTW, is the above UI some kind of interpreter process monitoring page ? It is pretty useful for zeppelin, do you have plan to contribute to zeppelin ?

Yup will do once i figure out why user name is `spark` instead of an actual user name such as `amandeep.kaur`. 

I'm running Zeppelin on Mesos mode. The above is Mesos UI. Pretty useful.
merge it if no more comments
Will merge if no more comments
LGTM
LGTM
@zjffdu after debugging a bit this new approach might not work for me because user is set as `spark` instead of LDAP user.
@zjffdu That's it. It's working now. Thanks.
@amakaur The user should be the zeppelin login user name. Do you enable LDAP in zeppelin ?
Yeah LDAP is enabled. It works as expected w/ original solution.
Oh, you might forget one thing, you need to set spark interpreter as user isolated.
I've it set as per note in isolated process
Still doesn't work for you in per user isolated mode ? What do you see in the spark app name ?

`spark.app.name` is set as `spark-2ESRB4NZ1`  . 

The following is an ex from the logs 
```Create Session: shared_session in InterpreterGroup: spark-2ENBYUKC2 for user: amandeep.kaur``` where user is LDAP user BUT `interpreterGroupId` contains `spark as a user value`

I would like to set spark.app.name to `amandeep.kaur-2ENBYUKC2`.
Ah, you are using per note isolated, you should use `per user isolated` in which case the interpreterGroupId will include user name.

I'm not sure if i'll be able to use `per user isolated` for zeppelin in prod because we would like each note to have its own JVM. Would using `per used isolated` create a single shared interpreter process for all of the notebooks that are under same user?
In that case, I think you can use per user isolated & per note isolated. Then the spark name would be `interpreter_name` + `user_name` + `noteId`
You can use a system classloader to get the list of realms. https://github.com/apache/shiro/blob/master/core/src/main/java/org/apache/shiro/config/IniSecurityManagerFactory.java#L193-L222

> @hsteinmueller Could you update the pom.xml to resolve the conflict ?

done

IIUC, user don't care about the implementation of sparql ( I may be wrong ), only administrator care about that, so we should put ti in interpreter setting which is often maintained by administrator.

I understood what you meant, I just wanted to know if this is needed right now or if we add this setting in the future when another implementation is needed.
Nonetheless I tried adding support for different implementations. I hope this works for you
I think it is fine to add this setting until there's another implementation.
@jpmcmu Any update ?
@liuxunorg Could you help review it ?
